titleStmt.title: The Journey
a hand-written transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman
titleStmt.sponsor: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, University of Nebraska-Lincoln

address.addrLine: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: Two drafts of a poem entitled "This journey." The lines were later incorporated as lines 6, 7, 8, and 9 in "L. of G.'s Purport," first published in 1891. On the verso are notes about "Payments to Mrs. White" between 1871 and 1874.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: L. of G.'s Purport
bibl.orgName: The Thomas Biggs Harned Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

The verso includes an inventory of payments made to a Mrs. White, as evident in the title written the top of the page. These payments commenced on March 1, 1871, and continue throughout June 1873. The notes are written in both alphabetical and numerical form.

l.del: Begun in amid my ripen'd youth, and stretchingsteadily
kept on and on, thro' life
I end it them ‸here in old age.
Delay'd at times, wandering, dallying, brief day

Delaying, dallying, wandering—,—never ‸—even for a single hour one day
abandon'd

lg.head: The journey
lg.l: Begun amid my ripen'd youth, and stead- ily kep on throughout life,

Wandering, ‸Peering dallying, seeking—war, ,and peace, ‸day, night ab-
sorbing—never even for a brief dayhour
abandoning,
I end it ‸all here in old age.
